Italian man tries authentic Japanese ramen. Koreans are amazed by their first ride on the bullet train. Why foreigners are choosing to work in Japan despite the weak yen. The fastest growing genre on Japanese YouTube is foreigners reacting to and celebrating Japan. That meme that we have in the west thing thing Japan the opposite exists here. Japanese karate teacher nobody bats an eyelash. Foreign karate teacher in Japan. Sir, may we make you a documentary? And the comment sections for these videos are always filled with conservative sentiment. It's always, "This makes me proud to be Japanese. Thank you for loving Japan. This reminds me of why I love this country so much." The members of the two groups social media has framed as utterly incompatible are often best friends in real life. Foreigners in Japan, the people that left their homes, flew halfway around the world, and learned an entirely new language because of their passion for Japanese culture. and Japanese conservatives, the citizens here most passionate about maintaining and celebrating that culture were both just superce So let not the distorted lens of social media but the experiences we have here shape our views on the country and its people. If each one of us does this, we may yet be able to lower the temperature and avoid the hyper polarization sweeping across much of the rest of the world right now. I implore all of us to touch some sheibahu because that simple act is what stands between this country becoming the hellscape sensationalist portray and the amazing nation it actually is.
